text:
Thank you! That means a lot to be told.

I have seen that! I’ve got a good understanding of NDAs now, I’ve signed a few and seen quite a lot of NDA stuff through Escape and events plus my boyfriend’s already done some NDA work in TV. A focus really does help. QVFX has been wonderful so far and a safe space is exactly what they’re going for. The main point of it is to act as a constant community for artists as they move between different facilities regularly. Everyone there is a really positive force so I’m really glad to be able to participate.

That’s a good idea and a good challenge! Thank you!

That’s true. I’ve used Maya so far thanks to their free student licenses. I’ve had a bit of experience with Mocha through Silhouette but I’ve heard it around quite a lot so I’m definitely gonna get some practice in.

It is important. I still struggle with imposter syndrome to an extent. I tend to compare myself very critically to other artists but it’s a process of learning to be kinder to myself. Experiences like showing my reel at MPC and the interview have been really helpful and it’s really motivational. That’s gotta be a good feeling. That makes sense. I appreciate you pointing that out.

Two very good points! There’s an undeniable instant credibility you get from DNEG. It would create more opportunities itself going forward.
For comparison the best exercise is to only compare yourself to yourself. Compare your recent work to last year's.
